title: Why French prosecutors investigating X summoned Elon Musk
subhead: The French investigation that led to a raid on the Paris offices of X on Tuesday is examining a wide range of alleged offenses.

title: Benjamin Netanyahu's four-state solution
subhead: Rather than accept the coexistence of Israel with a demilitarized Palestine, the Israeli prime minister has chosen to divide Palestinian territory into three distinct entities.

title: Gabriella Papadakis, ice dancer: 'My mother turned me into a little soldier who let herself be guided by the decisions of others'
subhead: 'I wouldn't be where I am today if...' In this series, Le Monde interviews a personality about a decisive moment in their life. The figure skater and former Olympic champion looks back on a childhood filled with constraints in order to succeed in a demanding and conservative environment.

France's 2026 budget battle is finally over. The next one may be even more complex.
subhead: The Finance Ministry is already working on the next budget bill. On paper, France will need to make a deficit reduction effort twice as great as in 2026. It will be a daunting challenge, so close to the presidential election.

title: Blocking the Russian army: Ukraine's impossible mission
subhead: With limited technical and human resources, soldiers and engineers in these units, increasingly exposed to drone fire, are trying to contain the Russian army, which continues to make slow but steady advances.

title: Epstein case's poison spreads with release of new files
subhead: On January 30, the US Department of Justice released a new trove of documents related to the case of the sexual predator who died in prison in 2019. Far from clarifying the case's many gray areas, these files have only deepened the confusion.
